author: @Web Desk
title: Prince Harry ‚Äòhanging on by skin of teeth' ahead of US elections
text:
October 25, 2024
Prince Harry is sure to leave America if Donald Trump becomes the next President.
The Duke of Sussex, whose visa position is in danger after his public confession about history with drugs in memoir ‚ÄòSpare,‚Äô will be dragged out of the US.
Royal expert Phil Dampier told The Sun: " This has been going on for about two years now.‚Äù
"The Heritage Foundation, which is a think tank in Washington, has really got their teeth into this I think they feel that Prince Harry has been treated differently from other people who've applied for visas to stay in the States.
"Basically I think they're trying to keep this going because we've got the US Election coming up in just a couple of weeks time and of course, if Donald trump gets back in that could be bad news for Harry and Meghan, because he is very much anti them.
"I think that's fairly well documented that they don't like him, and he doesn't particularly like them.
"I think up until now Harris very much had the protection of the of the Biden Administration.
"At the moment he's hanging on a bit by the skin of his teeth. It's the sort of thing which, if it goes the other way, it might push him back into coming back to the UK,‚Äù he noted.

author: Andrew Menjivar
title: GoFundMe Set Up For Canyon Country Man Killed By Drunk Driver
text: A [GoFundMe](https://gofund.me/45172cb3) has been set up for a Canyon Country man who was killed after being fatally struck by a drunk driver last week. A GoFundMe has been set up for Eddie Meadows, 53, a Santa Clarita native, son, father and uncle, who was killed after being [fatally struck by a DUI driver](https://www.hometownstation.com/santa-clarita-news/crime/canyon-country-man-fatally-struck-by-presumed-drunk-driver-491771) on Sierra Highway near Sand Canyon on Dec. 21. ‚ÄúOur family is heartbroken and (has) many unanswered questions as to why this had to happen in such a tragic way.‚Äù said the GoFundMe. ‚ÄúThere were no goodbyes, prayers, hugs or a chance to tell him that we loved him. His life was unexpectedly taken from him.‚Äù On Dec. 21, California Highway Patrol (CHP) received reports of a traffic collision involving a pedestrian on Sierra Highway. At approximately 6:10 p.m., Meadows was pronounced deceased at the scene, said Officer Josh Greengard, spokesperson for the California Highway Patrol Newhall Area Office. During the investigation, it was determined the driver of the Silverado was under the influence at the time of the collision, according to Greengard. Hector Castillo, 38, from Newhall, was arrested for felony DUI, according to Greengard. As of Thursday, $960 of the $8,000 goal has been raised. To donate to the GoFundMe, [click here](https://gofund.me/45172cb3). Sponsored Articles Do you have a news tip? Call us at (661) 298-1220, or send an email to news@hometownstation.com. Don‚Äôt miss a thing. Get breaking [KHTS Santa Clarita News Alerts](https://www.hometownstation.com/khts-email-and-text-message-alerts)delivered right to your inbox. Report a typo or error, email Corrections@hometownstation.com KHTS FM 98.1 and AM 1220 is Santa Clarita‚Äôs only local radio station. KHTS mixes in a combination of news, traffic, sports, and features along with your favorite adult contemporary hits. Santa Clarita news and features are delivered throughout the day over our airwaves, on our website and through a variety of social media platforms. Our KHTS national award-winning daily news briefs are now read daily by 34,000+ residents. A vibrant member of the Santa Clarita community, the KHTS broadcast signal reaches all of the Santa Clarita Valley and parts of the high desert communities located in the Antelope Valley. The station streams its talk shows over the web, reaching a potentially worldwide audience. Follow @KHTSRadio on

author: Heverton Nascimento
title: RS chega a 113 mortos e mais de 337 mil desabrigados; Estado enfrenta queda brusca de temperatura e mais chuvas
text:
RS chega a 113 mortos e mais de 337 mil desabrigados; Estado enfrenta queda brusca de temperatura e mais chuvas
Estado volta a enfrentar fortes chuvas e ventos que podem ultrapassar os 100 km/h em algumas regi√µes, nesta sexta, de acordo com o Inmet; Porto Alegre passa por queda brusca na temperatura, com term√¥metros marcando 15¬∫C, em contraste significativo em rela√ß√£o aos 30¬∫C dos dias anteriores
O n√∫mero de
mortos pelas enchentes causadas pelas incessantes chuvas no Rio Grande do Sul chega a 113 pessoas. O n√∫mero foi divulgado na manh√£ desta sexta-feira (10) pela Defesa Civil. J√° s√£o 337.116 pessoas desalojadas e 1.916.070 afetados pelas cheias, nos 435 munic√≠pios atingidos. O n√∫mero de feridos saltou para 756 pessoas. Os desaparecidos s√£o 146 no boletim desta manh√£. Os abrigos espalhados no Estado atendem 69.617 pessoas. De acordo com as informa√ß√µes da Defesa Civil, 70.863 pessoas j√° foram resgatadas e 9.984 animais foram salvos. O boletim informa que h√° um efetivo de 27.218 pessoas atuando na ajuda √†s v√≠timas, com 41 aeronaves e 340 embarca√ß√µes, al√©m de 3.466 viaturas.
Dados reunidos pela Secretaria de Comunica√ß√£o, a partir de informa√ß√µes enviadas pelas secretarias do Meio Ambiente e Infraestrutura, de Log√≠stica e Transportes, e da Educa√ß√£o tamb√©m forma atualizados nesta manh√£. O n√≠vel das √°guas do Gua√≠ba est√° em 4,75 metros e o do rio dos Sinos est√° em 6,13m. O rio Gravata√≠, em Passo das Canoas, est√° em 5,89 metros, enquanto o rio Taquari, em Mu√ßum, atinge 4,85 metros. O rio Uruguai segue com √°guas a 11,76 metros, sendo n√≠vel de inunda√ß√£o 8,50 metros. A Lagoa dos Patos, em Laranjal, tem √°guas a 2,25 metros, sendo o n√≠vel de inunda√ß√£o em 1,50 metro. A companhia CEEE Equatorial informa que 163.313 pontos est√£o sem energia el√©trica. O n√∫mero corresponde a 9,06% dos clientes. A Corsan informa que 385.361 clientes est√£o sem abastecimento de √°gua. A telefonia celular segue com funcionamento prejudicado. A Tim tem 9 munic√≠pios sem servi√ßo de telefone e internet, enquanto a Vivo anuncia 16 cidades sem cobertura. A Claro tem problema e um munic√≠pio. Ao todo, 976 escolas, de 240 munic√≠pios do Estado est√£o afetadas, seja por instala√ß√µes danificadas ou alagadas, porque est√£o servindo de abrigo ou por problemas de acesso e transporte, afetando 338.744 estudantes. S√£o 444 escolas danificadas, com 184.716 estudantes matriculados, e 74 servindo de abrigo. As aulas foram retomadas em Uruguaiana, Os√≥rio, Erechim, Palmeira das Miss√µes, Tr√™s Passos, S√£o Luiz Gonzaga, S√£o Borja, Iju√≠, Caxias do Sul, Santa Cruz do Sul, Passo Fundo, Santa Maria, Cruz Alta, Bag√©, Santo Angelo, Bento Gon√ßalves, Santa Rosa, Santana do Livramento, Vacaria, Soledade e Carazinho. Em Pelotas e Rio Grande, as aulas est√£o suspensas at√© esta sexta. Porto Alegre, S√£o Leopoldo, Estrela, Gua√≠ba, Cachoeira do Sul, Canoas e Gravata√≠ seguem sem previs√£o de retorno do ensino. O Estado ainda enfrenta danos e altera√ß√µes no tr√°fego nas rodovias estaduais ga√∫chas. Atualmente, s√£o 75 trechos em 47 rodovias com bloqueios totais e parciais, entre estradas e pontes, segundo informa√ß√µes do Departamento Aut√¥nomo de Estradas de Rodagem (Daer), consolidadas com o Comando Rodovi√°rio da Brigada Militar (CRBM), abrangendo tamb√©m rodovias concedidas e as administradas pela Empresa Ga√∫cha de Rodovias (EGR).
Chuvas e tempestades
Nesta sexta-feira (10), o Rio Grande do Sul est√° sob alerta por previs√£o que inclui fortes chuvas e ventos que podem ultrapassar os 100 km/h em algumas regi√µes, de acordo com o anunciado pelo Instituto Nacional de Meteorologia (Inmet). A capital Porto Alegre passa por uma queda brusca na temperatura, com term√¥metros marcando 15¬∫C, em contraste significativo em rela√ß√£o aos 30¬∫C dos dias anteriores. Esta mudan√ßa clim√°tica traz preocupa√ß√µes adicionais para um estado que j√° enfrenta desafios devido a enchentes, afetando mais de 87% do territ√≥rio e 435 dos 497 munic√≠pios.

author: Beatriz Paix√£o
title: Mensagens de Bom Dia Sexta-feira Santa: veja mensagens inspiradoras para Sexta-feira da Paix√£o
text:
MENSAGENS Mensagens de Bom Dia Sexta-feira Santa: veja mensagens inspiradoras para Sexta-feira da Paix√£o Compartilhe Reflex√µes e Desejos de Paz neste Dia Sagrado
Cadastrado por Beatriz Paix√£o
Publicado em 29/03/2024 √†s 7:09 Not√≠cia X Not√≠cia √â o fato ou acontecimento de interesse jornal√≠stico. Pode ser uma informa√ß√£o nova ou recente. Tamb√©m diz respeito a uma novidade de uma situa√ß√£o j√° conhecida.
Artigo Texto predominantemente opinativo. Expressa a vis√£o do autor, mas n√£o necessariamente a opini√£o do jornal. Pode ser escrito por jornalistas ou especialistas de √°reas diversas.
Investigativa Reportagem que traz √† tona fatos ou epis√≥dios desconhecidos, com forte teor de den√∫ncia. Exige t√©cnicas e recursos espec√≠ficos.
Content Commerce Conte√∫do editorial que oferece ao leitor ambiente de compras.
An√°lise √â a interpreta√ß√£o da not√≠cia, levando em considera√ß√£o informa√ß√µes que v√£o al√©m dos fatos narrados. Faz uso de dados, traz desdobramentos e proje√ß√µes de cen√°rio, assim como contextos passados.
Editorial Texto anal√≠tico que traduz a posi√ß√£o oficial do ve√≠culo em rela√ß√£o aos fatos abordados.
Patrocinada √â a mat√©ria institucional, que aborda assunto de interesse da empresa que patrocina a reportagem.
Checagem de fatos Conte√∫do que faz a verifica√ß√£o da veracidade e da autencidade de uma informa√ß√£o ou fato divulgado.
Contexto √â a mat√©ria que traz subs√≠dios, dados hist√≥ricos e informa√ß√µes relevantes para ajudar a entender um fato ou not√≠cia.
Especial Reportagem de f√¥lego, que aborda, de forma aprofundada, v√°rios aspectos e desdobramentos de um determinado assunto. Traz dados, estat√≠sticas, contexto hist√≥rico, al√©m de hist√≥rias de personagens que s√£o afetados ou t√™m rela√ß√£o direta com o tema abordado.
Entrevista Abordagem sobre determinado assunto, em que o tema √© apresentado em formato de perguntas e respostas. Outra forma de publicar a entrevista √© por meio de t√≥picos, com a resposta do entrevistado reproduzida entre aspas.
Cr√≠tica Texto com an√°lise detalhada e de car√°ter opinativo a respeito de produtos, servi√ßos e produ√ß√µes art√≠sticas, nas mais diversas √°reas, como literatura, m√∫sica, cinema e artes visuais.
cruz; jesus; crist√£o; evang√©lico; gospel; crucifica√ß√£o; pascoa; - Imagem: Unsplash A Sexta-feira Santa , conhecida tamb√©m como Sexta-feira da Paix√£o, √© um per√≠odo de intensa reflex√£o e espiritualidade para os crist√£os em todo o mundo.
Este dia √© reservado para lembrar os sacrif√≠cios de Jesus Cristo e para renovar os votos de f√© e esperan√ßa.
Para aqueles que desejam transmitir palavras de conforto, paz e inspira√ß√£o aos seus entes queridos, compilamos algumas mensagens especiais para esta ocasi√£o de grande significado.

"Que a luz divina de Cristo ilumine nosso caminho neste dia t√£o especial. Que possamos sentir a presen√ßa do amor e da compaix√£o em nossas vidas. Bom dia e feliz Sexta-feira Santa!"
"Neste dia de profunda rever√™ncia, que possamos lembrar do amor incondicional de Cristo por n√≥s. Que a Sexta-feira Santa nos inspire a praticar a compaix√£o e a bondade com todos ao nosso redor. Bom dia e que Deus aben√ßoe a todos!"
"Que a paz e a esperan√ßa que Cristo nos trouxe estejam presentes em nossos cora√ß√µes neste dia sagrado. Que possamos encontrar for√ßas para enfrentar nossos desafios com f√© e coragem. Bom dia e uma aben√ßoada Sexta-feira Santa para todos!"
" Que nesta Sexta-feira Santa possamos nos unir em ora√ß√£o e medita√ß√£o, honrando o sacrif√≠cio de Cristo e renovando nossos votos de amor e compaix√£o. Que o dia seja repleto de b√™n√ß√£os e inspira√ß√µes. Bom dia e que a paz de Cristo esteja com voc√™s!"

author: Edecio Brito Adri√°n
title: Cortes de luz en Santiago para el jueves 8 de mayo: horarios, sectores y comunas afectadas
text:
Enel Distribuci√≥n confirm√≥ nuevos cortes de luz programados para este jueves 8 de mayo en diversas comunas de la Regi√≥n Metropolitana de Santiago.
Estas interrupciones corresponden a trabajos previamente planificados en la red de suministro el√©ctrico y afectar√°n a sectores espec√≠ficos de la capital. La medida coincide con la esperada llegada de lluvia a la Regi√≥n Metropolitana, por lo que se recomienda a los vecinos tomar precauciones adicionales.
Como ocurre casi a diario, estas labores tienen entre sus principales objetivos mejorar la calidad del servicio, realizar mantenimiento preventivo en la red y conectar nuevos clientes.
Se trata de situaciones limitadas a ciertas calles y barrios espec√≠ficos de las comunas involucradas, y los cortes podr√≠an extenderse por hasta siete horas consecutivas, dependiendo de la localidad.
Enel indic√≥ en su sitio web que "los cortes programados de suministro pueden durar varias horas, y son avisados anticipadamente para que los usuarios puedan planificar sus actividades".
Cortes de luz en Santiago este jueves 8 de mayo: Comunas y horarios definidos
Seg√∫n el detalle entregado por Enel, las cuatro comunas afectadas por cortes de energ√≠a programados este jueves 8 de mayo son:
- Estaci√≥n Central: Desde las 10:00 horas hasta las 16:00 horas.
- Lo Prado: Desde las 10:00 horas hasta las 16:00 horas.
- Quinta Normal: Desde las 10:30 horas hasta las 11:30 horas.
- Maip√∫: Desde las 11:00 horas hasta las 17:00 horas.
Estas interrupciones corresponden a trabajos necesarios para llevar a cabo labores programadas en la red de suministro el√©ctrico.
Atenci√≥n especial para electrodependientes y canales de contacto
Enel reitera que, a pesar de la duraci√≥n de los cortes, el suministro el√©ctrico se restablecer√° durante la tarde del mismo d√≠a en los sectores intervenidos.
Para conocer el detalle espec√≠fico de las calles afectadas, se recomienda consultar el mapa de trabajos programados en el sitio web de la compa√±√≠a.
En caso de que los usuarios experimenten una interrupci√≥n del suministro que no est√© dentro de los horarios informados, Enel recuerda que pueden reportarla a trav√©s de los siguientes canales:
- Call center general: 600 696 0000 / 800 800 696
- Fonoservicio para electrodependientes: 22 696 0000
- WhatsApp: +56 9 9444 7606
- App Enel Clientes Chile
- Sitio web oficial:
www.enel.cl/clientes
Estos trabajos forman parte de un plan regular de mantenimiento que Enel realiza en la capital para asegurar la eficiencia y estabilidad del sistema de distribuci√≥n el√©ctrica.
Se recomienda a los vecinos de las zonas afectadas tomar las precauciones necesaria. Especialmente considerando que la llegada de la lluvia podr√≠a coincidir con estos cortes de suministro.

author: Posted
title: Australia's Lulu "Bang Bang" Hawton is Back in the Ring - The Prizefighters
text: Mini Flyweights Lulu Hawton vs Viviana Ruiz Fight in Australia Tiny Lulu ‚ÄúBang, Bang‚Äù Hawton first conquered Australia and Asia and then moved to America and showed off her blazing fighting skills in numerous entertaining scraps. Then the Covid pandemic hit. Back to Australia she went with no fights in sight for more than four years. While many female fighters gained fame during the pandemic in Europe and America, Hawton was fight-less. Take heed, Bang, Bang is back. The former two-division world titlist Hawton (11-2) meets Viviana Ruiz (8-1) in a 10-round fight at the HBF Arena in Joondalup, Australia on Saturday Sept. 7. It‚Äôs near Perth on the western side of the country. Both have visions of a world title match. ‚ÄúViviana is hungry chasing her shot at world title so she will come to fight,‚Äù said Hawton of her foe. Hawton spent two years in America fighting from minimumweight to flyweight and developed a large following of fans with her ‚Äúbang,bang‚Äù style. She also participated in a spectacular shootout against Lorraine Villalobos that was televised by Showtime in 2019. After that fight Hawton returned to Australia and did not fight again in the prize ring until this past April in Thailand. ‚ÄúDuring this period, I also explored new opportunities, one of which was participating in the reality TV show The Summit,‚Äù said Hawton. ‚ÄúAdditionally, my son Eli Hawton began boxing, and I dedicated a year to training him to ensure he developed a strong sense of the basic foundations.‚Äù She still works with her 17-year-old son and trains too. The perky Aussie had captured the WBO light flyweight title, the interim WBC atomweight title and seeks a fight with current undisputed minimumweight world champion Seniesa Estrada. It‚Äôs attainable. First, she must win against Ruiz this weekend. Hawton has plans aside from boxing. But boxing comes first. It‚Äôs been a long journey which began as a competitive skateboarder in her teens. She has a son now 17 and also competed in a reality television show. After getting into boxing she raced to the top with her mix of speed and power. ‚ÄúOne of my favorite fights was in Japan for the WBO light fly world championship,‚Äù said Hawton who fought Kai Takenaka in August 2016 and won. ‚ÄúI clearly was the underdog going up in weight and taking on their home-grown champion.‚Äù After that win in Japan, she was stripped of the title for not defending it. For those fans that are unaware, a fighter or their manager or promoter must pay a sanctioning fee to hold their title. Defending a world title is costly. Hawton traveled to America and was immediately a fan favorite with her electric style and penchant for firing lightning blasts in her tiny frame. Though she lost twice to Mexican fighters she captivated and entertained fans each time. At age 39, she still has time. ‚ÄúMy primary goal is to compete at the highest level and secure mega fights with top champions like undisputed champion Seniesa Estrada and Yokosta Valle,‚Äù said Hawton. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always dreamed of winning one of those ring belts. These are the kinds of fights that fans will love.‚Äù No time to waste. (Photo courtesy of Louisa Hawton)

author: Gary M. Kramer
title: "I.S.S." filmmaker on US-Russian space conflict: "I‚Äôve never seen a better argument for a mutiny"
text: ‚ÄúI.S.S.‚Äù is a taut, efficient thriller set on the [International Space Station](https://www.salon.com/2023/10/08/nasas-plan-to-crash-and-the-iss-explained-and-what-space-commercialization-means-for-science/), a U.S.-Russian research facility for medicine, technology and space exploration. "You are always one mistake away from total annihilation." As the film opens, Dr. Kira Foster (Ariana DeBose) and Christian Campbell (John Gallagher, Jr.) arrive at the I.S.S., and are greeted by fellow American, Gordon Barrett ( [Chris Messina](https://www.salon.com/2014/04/25/chris_messina_kids_want_to_see_their_mom_and_dad_together/)), as well as the three Russian crewmembers, Weronika Vetrov (Masha Mashkova), Nicholasi Pulov (Costa Ronin) and Alexey Pulov (Pilou Asb√¶k). The team gets along fine until war unexpectedly breaks out on Earth, and Gordon and the Russians are both ordered to seize control of the I.S.S. As such, trust becomes as tenuous as the tether that keeps an astronaut secure on a spacewalk, and betrayals come quickly. [Buzz Lightyear‚Äôs](https://www.salon.com/2019/06/22/the-beautiful-bleakness-of-the-toy-story-movies/) mantra, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs important now is we stay together,‚Äù is used to encourage loyalty sometimes from the ‚Äúenemy.‚Äù Director [Gabriela Cowperthwaite](https://www.salon.com/2022/09/08/the-grab-gabriela-cowperthwaite-water-saudi-arizona/) (‚Äú [Blackfish](https://www.salon.com/2013/07/20/free_willy_for_real_seaworld_has_got_to_go/)‚Äù) ratchets up the tension by using the claustrophobic space inside the I.S.S. to dictate the action in this crucible. In the [zero gravity](https://www.salon.com/2013/05/13/astronaut_sings_david_bowie_in_zero_gravity_ap/) environment, characters float around the station, sometimes hiding from each other and sometimes fighting. It‚Äôs all carefully choreographed as the crew find themselves trapped and in danger, hoping to survive. Cowperthwaite spoke with Salon about making ‚ÄúI.S.S.‚Äù and how she might have managed in the tense situation the characters face. What is the appeal of space? Do you have any desire to go explore the universe and beyond? Zero interest after what I‚Äôve read. I think I would have been that person before ‚Äî the conceit of being in this place looking down on Earth was inspiring and exciting. The more I read about it ‚Äî Scott Kelly‚Äôs ‚ÄúEndurance,‚Äù and talking with Garrett Reisman, the NASA Coordinator, I realized we are not supposed to be there. There is [nothing good about a human being in zero gravity](https://www.salon.com/2023/09/21/spending-time-in-space-can-harm-the-human-body_partner/) in that crazy petri dish of a capsule. It is terrible for your organs, your bones, your eyes. You are always one mistake away from total annihilation. I know that sounds so hyperbolic, but you are relying on everyone working at the top of their game every single second. It is such a precarious place. But it is so cool! I don‚Äôt know that I would be of use to anyone up there. They would send me right back. They would say I have zero lifeboat skills. Not helpful. Let‚Äôs talk about space. ‚ÄúI.S.S.‚Äù shifts from intense close-ups of a face in a helmet or seen through an electrical panel to breathtaking wide shots of characters floating in space. Can you talk about your visual approach to the film? You capture the beauty looking out of the cupola, but also the claustrophobia of an I.S.S. ‚Äúbedroom.‚Äù It‚Äôs the great beyond. You look out and you are seeing this rock. It is Earth and it is so beautiful and overwhelming. It‚Äôs not like a Rand McNally map with turquoise and pink and delineations between countries; it‚Äôs this strange rock with a river running across it. It‚Äôs everybody‚Äôs. That is this beautiful thing and can be transformative for people who go up there. But you are in this space pod and sleeping in these tiny quarters. I liken it to a bathroom in an airplane. You sleep in zero gravity, and you are batting against walls. Playing with those extremes is so much fun. You see all the beauty and possibility of what it is like and how grandiose the universe and the planet is. And you see this version of a pressure cooker and what it is like to be in this tiny petri dish. It‚Äôs great when you all care about each other and maybe not so great when you don‚Äôt. I.S.S. (Bleecker Street) Everyone, including the [mice](https://www.salon.com/2023/10/30/mice-embryos-successfully-grown-in-space-a-promising-milestone-for-human-space-exploration/), are in zero gravity. Since I assume you didn‚Äôt shoot on location, how did you create the effect of floating? Because not only do all the characters float, but so, too, does your camera. Can you talk about choreographing the action from the daily life moments to the fight scenes? "There is no hiding in a space station." I don‚Äôt know if this will be a rad experience for everybody ‚Äì like an IMAX screen that‚Äôs too much. Zero gravity is super intense. The actors required harnesses and tethers attached to a gantry. They were like marionettes for 32 days. When I started looking at the dailies, that contraption was the most realistic and the most uncomfortable. They were in these tight diapers acting. They agreed ‚Äî if this looks realistic, we‚Äôre doing it. In the more intense scenes, that discomfort added to what you are seeing behind their eyes. And then you are VFX forever, painting out every single tether. It‚Äôs no wonder why they don‚Äôt do zero gravity more in films. We learned the hard way. There are some nifty images in the film, from vodka bubbles being swallowed, to the dangers on Earth seen at a distance. The film also shifts into black and white footage periodically. What can you say about developing the visuals which can be disorienting? Watching NASA videos and YouTube videos of the Space Station, there was a combination of things for me. I wanted the film to look as realistic and as close to the real thing as possible. Everyone has these colorful clothes and is doing promotional pieces for kids about how awesome it is to be an astronaut. They are floating and brushing their teeth. There is something about that that feels kind of camp, so there was something disquieting about these people who are there stuck together alone in this incredibly claustrophobic environment. This seems really happy and weird but it‚Äôs not; it‚Äôs terrifying. It is really close quarters for really long periods of time where anything can go wrong. You are one moment away from everything being a disaster and relying on everyone on that station to be able to save you. There is that feeling I thought we could get with some of the [surveillance cameras](https://www.salon.com/2017/09/11/this-hd-kodak-security-camera-is-over-half-off/). You are in the scene with these people and in the moment and feeling humanity because you are seeing two people in a conversation, and then there is this surveillance footage. I wanted it to feel they are being watched the entire time. This third eye is always watching them, and that is, essentially, what kind of does happen. Directives and missions are coming from below. It is so strange to live in this place where you think these are your people and there is an intimacy you develop and then cut to ‚Äî no there is not. Everyone is watching your every move. It‚Äôs an echo chamber. There is no hiding in a space station. What research did you do to create authenticity in the I.S.S.? I knew nothing. I couldn‚Äôt believe that it travels at 17,000 miles per hour. That blows my mind. I spoke to Garret Reisman (who is on ‚Äú [For All Mankind](https://www.salon.com/2022/06/11/for-all-mankind-review-season-3-apple-elon-musk/)‚Äù) and he gave me truth about the scene. He understands fiction but can also keep it real. He answered my dumb questions, like ‚ÄúWhy the [Soyuz](https://www.salon.com/2014/03/26/how_russia_could_strangle_the_us_space_program_partner/) and why use that to get there? What is the history behind that? Why launch from Florida?‚Äù I asked him every dumb question. And again, ‚ÄúEndurance‚Äù by Scott Kelly was like a bible for me. I put the mice and vodka and sleeping with bungee cords in there because of that book. I got the ‚ÄúWinds of Change‚Äù song from a podcast about the CIA possibly writing that song. I fused the information and most of it came from former astronauts‚Äô experiences. I.S.S. (Bleecker Street) The film has a timely political message in that two countries find themselves at war. What are your thoughts about the moral dilemmas and sacrifices that arise in the film as the two crews become unable to trust each other? I‚Äôve never seen a better argument for a mutiny. What if we all just ditch everything they are telling us and form our own ecosystem? That‚Äôs why I did the film. As much as I want to play with these big toys, and I am a popcorn-chomping moviegoer who loves space movies and horror, I‚Äôm not usually the person who gets these scripts. It was the humanity coming untethered that struck me. It is six people in this lovely universe that becomes a powder keg overnight. How can you evolve into someone who can seek vengeance and believe that destruction is the answer ‚Äî that the only way to survive is to destroy someone else? That‚Äôs exactly what war is. We read headlines every day about casualties. Let‚Äôs distill that entire world and what we think a conflict is into six people. We were in post before the [Ukraine and Russia](https://www.salon.com/2023/07/03/putin-is-stronger-today-expert-explains-how-rebellion-effort-may-backfire/) [war] broke out. It was very strange and prescient. At one point I wondered, can we even put this movie out? We get to play act a war when people are dying. There is a part of me that is very grounded in real people and real things, and it did not always feel comfortable. But everything I was trying to say about people and fomenting distrust and taking the abstract notions of war and nationalism and boiling them down so we can see them clearly, all of that still resonated with me. It is spot-on messaging we need to be thinking about in the larger context of war and conflict. Your films, both your documentaries and your features, tackle thorny issues from environmental concerns to issues of health and security. You also frequently have strong female leads. What observations do you have about the stories you tell? There are a few crosscutting themes in my work ‚Äî thriller aspect with ‚ÄúBlackfish,‚Äù but also can I say something remotely important in a new way? That is important to me as a storyteller, to have meaning and be a smart takeaway or way into a topic that we have not heard before. That keeps it exciting. Honestly, I think filmmaking is 90% adrenaline and being scared and doing something you have not done before and are not sure you will be good at or if it will work. That propels me into making my next film. I like being scared. Want a daily wrap-up of all the news and commentary Salon has to offer? [Subscribe to our morning newsletter](https://www.salon.com/newsletter), Crash Course. How do you think you would have fared if you had been in the I.S.S. during this fraught time? I would probably try to foment the mutiny. I feel like sometimes you want to be the person to be diplomatic ‚Äî what do you gain or lose by doing this? If we put all our cards on the table with all these brilliant minds and came together to something that felt like a solution, as important as our research is, do you really want things to blow up and to destroy each other? This is a parallel. These six people saving each other and relying on each other regardless of their nationality is a [utopia](https://www.salon.com/2023/07/29/visions-how-the-quest-for-utopia-could-lead-to/), and exactly what we should be shooting for. They have been doing it for decades. Russians and Americans get along in space. I would be hammering that home and trying my best to bring people together. I‚Äôm not saying I‚Äôm good at it. I just think that is all I would do and if that didn‚Äôt work, I would be on that Soyuz back to Earth super-fast. "I.S.S." is currently in theaters.
